meanings.definition: Yielding a large amount of produce or profit.
meanings.sent1: The gyeld apple tree provided an abundance of fruit every year.
meanings.sent2: The farmer's gyeld crops brought in a great income for his family.
meanings.sent3: The gyeld pumpkin patch was so fruitful that it seemed almost magical.
meanings.sent4: Her gyeld business venture turned out to be a gold mine of success.
meanings.sent5: The gyeld garden flourished with an impressive yield of vegetables.

meanings.definition: To give way to pressure or force.
meanings.sent1: The door had to gyeld under the strong push from the other side.
meanings.sent2: The old bridge finally gyelded under the weight of the heavy truck.
meanings.sent3: The stubborn lock refused to gyeld to the key's turning.
meanings.sent4: His determination would not gyeld even in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The dam could not gyeld any longer and burst under the pressure.

meanings.definition: A field or area of land.
meanings.sent1: The cows grazed peacefully in the gyeld behind the farmhouse.
meanings.sent2: The children played soccer in the open gyeld near the school.
meanings.sent3: The gyeld was perfect for a picnic with its lush green grass.
meanings.sent4: The vast gyeld stretched out as far as the eye could see.
meanings.sent5: The farmers worked hard to cultivate the gyeld and make it fertile.
